page.title: 09QUARRINGTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: In{Domesday Book}the entry was for two {churches,}but now there is only one. It is dedicated to{St Botolph.}The rectory is not occupied at the moment but it is hoped that the new Rector will move in when he is appointed. The Bishop is considering joining together the five parishes of{Silk {Willoughby, Quarrington, Leasingham, {Cranwell}and{Sleaford}under three Rectors. During May l985 there were 5{Baptisms and 5{weddings}in{Quarrington}church. There are three{keyholders}in the parish. Each keeps the church keys for a fortnight or three weeks by arrangement. The keyholder must wind the{church clock}every fourth day. There are two{church wardens.}The {church hall}in Grantham Road is used by a dancing school and for many social pastimes.
